main_question: What do Canadians remember on Remembrance Day?
question: What do Canadians remember on Remembrance Day?
possible_answers: A. Canadian victory in World War I
B. Canadian victory in the Battle of Vimy Ridge
C. Canadian victory in World War II
D. Sacrifices made by Canadian veterans and brave soldiers in wars
answer: D. Sacrifices made by Canadian veterans and brave soldiers in wars
explanatory_sentence: Canadians wear the red poppy and observe a moment of silence at the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month to honour the sacrifices of over a million brave men and women who have served, and the 110,000 who have given their lives.
